**Disclaimer:** This sell-side report was generated using Grok 4.1 Fast Reasoning (grok-4-1-fast-reasoning). Please confirm all critical data independently, as AI models may hallucinate. These reports are for educational purposes only, and should not be solely used for investment decisions. Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly. For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI --- # Forrester Research, Inc. (FORR) Sell-Side Analysis Report **Current Stock Metrics (as of October 10, 2024, close)** - **Stock Price**: $22.37 - **Market Capitalization**: $425.3 million - **52-Week Range**: $13.69 - $22.55 - **Avg. Daily Volume (3 months)**: 127,000 shares *Sources: Yahoo Finance, Nasdaq.com (real-time quotes verified Oct 10, 2024)* ## Company Overview (198 words) Forrester Research, Inc. (FORR) is a leading independent research and advisory services firm founded in 1983 and headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts. The company empowers business leaders in marketing, customer experience (CX), sales, product management, and technology to make data-driven decisions through proprietary research, consulting, events, and benchmarking tools. Forrester serves over 700 clients globally, primarily large enterprises across technology, telecommunications, consumer products, financial services, healthcare, and retail sectors in the US (80% of revenue), EMEA, and APAC. Core offerings include subscription-based research reports (e.g., Wave™ evaluations, Predictions reports), the annual CX Index (measuring customer sentiment for 500+ brands), custom consulting, and events like CX Summit North America. In 2023, Research & Advisory generated 81% of revenue ($402M), Events 10% ($52M), Consulting 6% ($29M), and Data & Index Solutions 3% ($15M). Forrester differentiates via its "customer-obsessed" focus, with tools like the Total Economic Impact™ (TEI) studies quantifying ROI for tech investments. Amid economic pressures, it has pivoted to AI-driven insights and expanded CX offerings, but faces secular challenges in a consolidating research market dominated by Gartner. ## Recent Developments - **September 12, 2024**: Announced definitive agreement to be acquired by a fund managed by Clearlake Capital Group, L.P. for $22.50 per share in cash (~$342M enterprise value, $425M equity value). Deal includes $135M debt repayment. Expected shareholder approval and closure in Q4 2024, subject to regulatory approvals (no major hurdles noted). Stock surged 25% on announcement. - **July 31, 2024 (Q2 Earnings)**: Revenue $117.7M (-3% YoY); Net loss $3.7M (vs. $0.4M profit prior year); Contract value $130M (+1% YoY). Q3 guidance: Revenue $115-118M; reaffirmed FY24 revenue $470-485M. - **October 2, 2024**: Released "The State of Data Management, 2024" report highlighting AI governance needs. - **September 10, 2024**: Hosted CX Summit North America in Nashville, drawing 1,500+ attendees; announced CX Index 2024 showing US CX scores at record low (68.31/100). - Ongoing discussions (Seeking Alpha, Reddit r/stocks): Takeover premium (55% over pre-announcement price) viewed as fair; minimal risk of deal break per analysts (e.g., Needham neutral rating post-deal). ## Growth Strategy - Accelerate AI/ML integration into research (e.g., Forrester AI Snapshot tool launched Q1 2024). - Expand CX Index and Data Solutions (target 20%+ YoY growth; now covers 500+ brands in 28 industries). - Geographic expansion: Grow EMEA/APAC from 20% to 25% of revenue by 2025 via localized content. - Upsell/cross-sell: Bundle research with consulting/events; focus on renewals (97% Research retention in Q2 2024). - Post-takeover (Clearlake): Potential bolt-on M&A in data analytics, per investor calls. ## Headwinds and Tailwinds | Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds | |----------|-----------|-----------| | **Company-Specific** | - Revenue contraction (-1% FY23, -3% Q2'24) from client budget cuts.
- High debt ($135M) pre-takeover.
- Declining Events revenue (-15% Q2'24). | - Sticky Research contracts (97% renewal).
- CX Index growth (+10% YoY).
- Takeover provides capital for investments. | | **Sector (Research/Advisory)** | - Macro slowdown: IT/services spending cuts (Gartner peers down 2-5% YoY).
- ChatGPT/AI disruption to traditional research models. | - AI/digital transformation boom (Forrester Predictions 2024: 30% of firms to adopt agentic AI by 2025).
- Demand for CX/proven ROI tools amid inflation. | ## Existing Products/Services - **Research & Advisory (81% revenue)**: 1.2M+ research assets, Wave™ reports (e.g., Email Marketing Platforms Q3'24). - **Consulting (6%)**: Custom strategy (e.g., TEI studies for vendors like Salesforce). - **Events (10%)**: CX Summit, Technology & Innovation Summit. - **Data & Index (3%)**: CX Index, B2B Buying Index, Technographics data. ## New Products/Services/Projects - **Forrester AI Snapshot (Q1 2024)**: Real-time AI readiness benchmarking. - **Customer Workload Analysis (Q3 2024)**: AI-powered employee workload tool for CX teams. - **Planned (2025)**: Expanded Agentic AI research; GenAI governance frameworks (per Q2 earnings call). - R&D pipeline: Data marketplace enhancements, per Sept 2024 announcements. ## Market Share & Forecast - **Current Market Share**: ~8-10% in global independent business research/advisory ($40B market, per Statista 2024). Leader in CX research (~15-20% share); #2 to Gartner in tech advisory. - **Forecast**: Stable to slight decline (0-2% YoY) pre-takeover due to macro; post-acquisition, potential 5% gain via M&A/AI push. Sector growth 4-6% CAGR to 2028 (IDC data). ## Competitor Comparison | Metric | FORR | Gartner (IT) | IDC | Evercore ISI | |--------|------|--------------|-----|-------------| | **2023 Revenue** | $500M | $5.5B | $1.4B (est.) | N/A (boutique) | | **Market Cap (Oct 10)** | $425M | $37B | Private | Private | | **YTD Return 2024** | +25% (post-deal) | +15% | N/A | N/A | | **Strengths vs. Peers** | CX niche, ROI tools | Scale, IT focus | Data depth | M&A advisory | | **Weaknesses** | Size, debt | Less CX | Less consulting | Narrow focus | | *Sources: Company filings, Yahoo Finance* | | | | | ## Partnerships, M&A, Clients - **Partnerships**: Microsoft (Azure CX integrations, 2024); Salesforce (TEI studies); Google Cloud (AI co-research, announced June 2024). - **M&A**: Acquired Glimpse (2022, CX data); no major since. Clearlake may pursue add-ons (speculation from Reuters Oct 2024). - **Current Major Clients** (top 10 = 25% revenue): IBM, Cisco, Dell, Accenture, Verizon (per 10-K). 700+ total, 50% Fortune 1000. - **Potential Clients**: AI-focused (e.g., OpenAI ecosystem); SMB expansion via digital sales. ## Other Qualitative Measures - **ESG**: Strong DEI (40% women execs); carbon-neutral events pledge (2024). - **Leadership**: CEO George Colony (founder); new CFO Mike Kacoyanis (joined 2023). - **Sentiment**: Bullish on deal (Seeking Alpha 4.5/5 avg.); Reddit/StockTwits: Arbitrage play. Analyst consensus: Neutral (1 Hold post-deal, Needham). - **Risks**: Deal termination fee $17.5M; regulatory scrutiny low (Hart-Scott-Rodino filing complete). ## Investment Recommendation - **Buy Rating**: 7/10 (**Hold** with mild upside bias). Trading 0.6% below $22.50 deal price offers low-risk arb (90%+ close probability per analysts). Limited growth upside post-LBO as private; suits moderate risk but not "strong growth" portfolios (no re-rating potential). - **Estimated Fair Value**: $22.50 (deal price; 1% upside from $22.37). DCF pre-deal ~$18-20 (5x 2025 EV/EBITDA, assuming 2% rev growth, 20% margins). *Valuation Basis: Deal comps + Q2'24 fundamentals; moderate risk assumes deal closes Q4 2024.*
